definition: spirit of loyalty and self-sacrifice/code of brotherhood/also pr. [yi4 qi5]
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to be loyal (to one's friends)/to value loyalty

sentences.english: It is out of personal loyalty that others help you.
sentences.chinese: 别人帮助你那是义气，你不能当作是理所应当的。

sentences.english: He values personal loyalty at the expense of principles.
sentences.chinese: 他太讲义气，损害了原则。

sentences.english: He is still loyal to his friend although she hurt him once.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她曾经伤害过他，他对这个朋友还是讲义气的。

sentences.english: I appreciate him very much because he is a filial son and a righteous friend.
sentences.chinese: 我蛮欣赏他的，因为他很孝顺，对朋友也很讲重义气。

sentences.english: He is especially loyal to his friends, and willing to do anything to help them.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人特讲义气，甘愿为朋友两肋插刀。

sentences.english: The Qing Hao very ample sense of glory also always accompanies oneself to persevere hunger.
sentences.chinese: 倾皓很够义气也总是会陪着自己挨饿。

sentences.english: With friends, they tested your integrity.
sentences.chinese: 当你交友时，朋友考验你的义气。

definition: to be loyal (to one's friends)/to value loyalty
to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
to help the needy for justice (idiom); to be loyal to one's friends and generous to the needy
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
righteousness/virtuous cause/a woman's marriage/main points of a piece of writing
